inflammation package

Submodules

inflammation.models module

Module containing models representing patients and their data.

The Model layer is responsible for the ‘business logic’ part of the software.

Patients’ data is held in an inflammation table (2D array) where each row contains inflammation data for a single patient taken over a number of days and each column represents a single day across all patients.

inflammation.models.daily_above_threshold(patient_num, data, threshold)

Determine whether or not each daily inflammation value exceeds a given threshold for a given patient.

Parameters:

  • patient_num – The patient row number

  • data – A 2D data array with inflammation data

  • threshold – An inflammation threshold to check each daily value against

Returns:

An integer representing the number of days a patient’s inflammation is over a given threshold

inflammation.models.daily_max(data)

Calculate the daily max of a 2D inflammation data array.

inflammation.models.daily_mean(data)

Calculate the daily mean of a 2D inflammation data array.

inflammation.models.daily_min(data)

Calculate the daily min of a 2D inflammation data array.

inflammation.models.daily_std(data)

Calculate the daily std of a 2D inflammation data array.

inflammation.models.load_csv(filename)

Load a Numpy array from a CSV

Parameters:

filename – Filename of CSV to load

inflammation.views module

Module containing code for plotting inflammation data.

inflammation.views.visualize(data_dict)

Display plots of basic statistical properties of the inflammation data.

Parameters:

data_dict – Dictionary of name -> data to plot

Module contents

Package containing the bulk of code for the patient data system.
